  • PC

  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

A seven-minute introduction to the survival action game.

Rebellion Developments have released an seven-minute gameplay overview trailer for survival action game Atomfall.

Get the details below.

In this official gameplay trailer, we unveil the dangers and mysteries awaiting you in our gripping new single-player survival action game, Atomfall. Atomfall is inspired by the real-life events of the 1957 Windscale disaster and the story picks up five years later in a fictionalised quarantine zone that encompasses rolling countryside, valleys, caves and even a picturesque English village.

But this picture-perfect postcard setting is a hostile landscape that hides a dark mystery. To get to the bottom of what happened at Windscale, you will need to navigate military encampments, delve through abandoned bunkers below ground, and risk your life in Pagan ruins. Your trusty metal detector will also help you uncover a few secrets buried beneath the surface!

Central to the dark mystery are the host of eccentric characters and cryptic organisations that inhabit the quarantine zone. These individuals have been cut off from the outside world for years and left to their own devices, so are anything but normal. Your interactions with them are important and will shape your journey. But be careful, they aren’t all friendly and you will need to get to grips with an array of ranged and melee weapons if you are to survive!

Atomfall is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC via Steam, Epic Games Store, and Microsoft Store on March 27. It will also be available via Game Pass.

item.title: AI LIMIT pre-orders, new demo now available
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/ai-limit-pre-orders-new-demo-now-available

  • PC
  • PS5

Standard edition priced at $34.99.

Publisher CE-Asia and developer SenseGames have opened pre-orders for AI LIMIT for PlayStation 5 via PlayStation Store and PC via Steam. A new demo is also available.

The standard edition is priced at $34.99 / £34.99, while the Deluxe Edition is priced at $44.99 / £44.99. The latter includes the full game, the exclusive in-game armor and helmet “White Sparrow’s Coat & Mask,” the weapon “Opossums Sais,” a digital art book, three Mud Balls, and three Pure Crystals.

Pre-orders for either edition include 10 percent off the standard price, as well as a bonus Maid outfit and hairband.

Get the latest details below.

New Trailer

The new trailer showcases new scenes of Havenswell, the last city of humanity, depicting the ongoing conflicts between various factions. Hunters and scavengers roam the ruins, constantly fighting for a glimmer of hope from the city’s true master—the Church and the Necro. In addition to the protagonist Arrisa, several other NPCs, including new Bladers, make their debut, with their stories awaiting players to uncover as they progress through the game.

New Demo

A demo will also available on Steam and PlayStation 5 during the pre-order. The development team has tweaked the game’s performance, visuals and gameplay to reflect the community’s feedback. Boss Challenge mode in the demo now features new weapons, equipment, and spells. It is highly recommended that both old and new players give it a try.

About the Game

AI LIMIT sees players take up arms in the post-apocalyptic wasteland of Havenswell as Arrisa, an immortal Blader. Facing formidable enemies from various factions, players must navigate the ruins on the edge of civilization’s extinction, seeking the truth behind its destruction.

item.title: PERISH studio ITEM42 announces single-player first-person shooter DEFICIT for PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/perish-studio-item42-announces-single-player-first-person-shooter-deficit-for-pc

  • PC

Close-quarters combat, lethal tools, and environmental havoc.

PERISH studio ITEM42 has announced DEFICIT, a new single-player campaign first-person shooter currently in development. It will be available for PC via Steam. A release date has yet to be announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

You are a corporate espionage freelancer. Your latest assignment: steal the reality-shifting Interpolator from the sprawling research labs of Project Sidereal. Use the device to escape the grueling defensive layers of Hadrian’s Wall and cross the threshold into the strangest frontiers of reality.

Steal

Designation: [Carrie]. Location: [Project Sidereal].

Assignment: under the instruction of your shady benefactor known only as [The Client], you must steal the [Interpolator] and use it to escape the sprawling research labs of Project Sidereal.

Fight

Project Sidereal is housed within Hadrian’s Wall, a maze of concrete warrens and liminal installations policed by the seasoned officers of the Oversight Taskforce.

Sneak past them, turn their defensive systems against them or take them head-on: the best path through the manifold dangers of Project Sidereal is yours to choose.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Evade

One final instruction: avoid the attention of the Overseer and his legion of mechanical Prosecutors, at all cost.

As always: if you get caught, you’re on your own, freelancer.

Key Features

  • Single-player campaign first-person shooter with an emphasis on chaotic close-quarters combat, creatively lethal tools, and environmental havoc.
  • Exploration: take the direct route or find the path less travelled through the warrens of Hadrian’s Wall.
  • Open wormholes to terrifying frontier realities on valid surfaces to navigate otherwise impassable liminal spaces.
  • Face a medley of adversaries: haphazard Oversight Officers, ruthlessly precise Servitor mechanoids, and frangible UAVs.
  • Hammers, screwdrivers, paintcans, bricks, batons, pistols, SMGs: any item makes for a tremendous weapon in the hands of a skilled freelancer.

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.

item.title: The House of the Dead 2: Remake launches this spring for PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/the-house-of-the-dead-2-remake-launches-this-spring-for-ps5-xbox-series-ps4-xbox-one-switch-and-pc

The House of the Dead 2: Remake will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam and GOG this spring, publisher Forever Entertainment and developer MegaPixel Studio announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via Forever Entertainment:

About

The House of the Dead 2: Remake is a remake of the second entry in the well-known and popular rail shooter series. Take on the lone role of a secret agent as James or Gary, or team up in cooperative mode to neutralize the dangerous undead monsters standing in your way.

Story

In February 2000, a small city was suddenly overrun by hostile creatures. Two AMS agents, James Taylor and Gary Stewart, were sent to investigate. Upon arrival, they noticed that the situation resembled the Curien Mansion incident from 1998. Determined to uncover the source of the infestation, they began shooting their way through hordes of creatures.

Key Features

  • Remastered music (with the classic soundtrack also available in the game).
  • Modern graphics.
  • Gameplay faithful to the original game.
  • Cooperative mode.
  • Multiple endings and branching levels.

Various Game Modes

  • Classic Campaign – Almost two years after the events of the first installment, AMS agents James Taylor and Gary Stewart are deployed to investigate a city seized by undead creatures.
  • Boss Mode – Take on the challenge of defeating the game’s bosses as fast as you can.
  • Training Mode – Polish your skills in several available training scenarios to improve your abilities before deploying on a mission.

item.title: AstralShift announces Hell Maiden – an original retelling of Dante’s Divine Comedy
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/astralshift-announces-hell-maiden-an-original-retelling-of-dantes-divine-comedy

The studio behind Little Goody Two Shoes.

Little Goody Two Shoes studio AstralShift has announced Hell Maiden, an original retelling of the Italian Renaissance classic Divine Comedy by Dante Alighieri. Platforms, a release window, and details about the game’s contnet were not announced, but AstralShift did confirm it will branch out from the familiar horror RPG genre of its previous titles.

AstralShift will be sharing regular updates on Hell Maiden across its Twitter and Bluesky accounts, including character reveals, the game’s genre, mechanics, and development progress.
